detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: If this section if FULL or BLOCKED please sign up for the corresponding waitlist section. Once you have registered in the wait list there is no need to contact the department. Your registration will be switched to the parent section when space becomes available. Preference may be given to Majors, Minors, or Honours students in Theatre or Film. For more information about Department of Theatre and Film wait lists please visit: http://theatrefilm.ubc.ca/undergraduate/undergraduate-courses/how-to-wait-list-a-course/

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: This course is restricted to BFA students in The Departmnet of Theatre & Film, and BA Theatre Studies students.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Delivery Mode -This is an in-person course. Students are expected to meet in-person on the days and times listed. All courses labelled as ‘in-person’ are fully in-person for the entire term, including exams, and require in-person attendance to complete.

Waitlist Policy -All waitlists will follow a first come, first serve policy, unless specified otherwise. Once a course is full, its status will be changed to “Waitlist” and students who register will be automatically added to the waitlist.

detailResultFields.value:
Delivery Mode -This is an in-person course. Students are expected to meet in-person on the days and times listed. All courses labelled as ‘in-person’ are fully in-person for the entire term, including exams, and require in-person attendance to complete.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Cross listed with UKRN 225. Do you have a connection to the Ukrainian nation? Curious to know about Ukrainian language and culture? Want to stand with Ukraine in the struggle for its sovereignty and the peaceful democratic future of the world? It's time to turn your dreams into reality! This 6-credit course will help you build confidence in communicating in a language which is quite different from Germanic and Romance languages as well as introduce you to the life of contemporary Ukraine, its rich culture and history. 

Sample syllabus here.

Interested in other courses within the Department of Central, Eastern and Northern European Studies? Click here.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: VISA 110 001 lecture is delivered online. The studio (tutorial) sections are delivered in person. You must sign up for both the lecture and one of the studio sections. There is no waitlist for VISA 110. Please check regularly for seats, particularly at the start of term as students are rearranging their schedules.

VISA_V 183-001 - Foundation Studio: Ideas as Practice I

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
VISA 183 001 lecture is delivered online. The studio (tutorial) sections are delivered in person. You must sign up for both the lecture and one of the studio sections.

There is a quiet study space booked for class during the lecture timeslot (Thursdays, 9:00–10:00 am). You can use this space to attend the online lecture (using your own device) if you are on campus and prefer a quiet space to listen to the lecture, ask questions, etc. IBLC room 185 at 1961 East Mall (the Irving K. Barber Learning Centre).

There is no waitlist for VISA 183. Please check regularly for seats, particularly at the start of term as students are rearranging their schedules.

WRDS_V 150-A_001 - Writing and Research in the Disciplines (A)

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
WRDS 150A is ONLY for students in the Faculty of Arts. 
 Visit WRDS 150A Topics - Term 1 - School of Journalism, Writing, and Media (ubc.ca) for WRDS 150A course topics.

If this section is closed (full), you can register for the waiting list at this JWAM link:  https://jwam.ubc.ca/wrds-150a-waitlist-winter-terms-1-2/

Students in other Faculties: Use the 'Search' field for WRDS 150-B.

uiLabels.WDRES.FACETEDSEARCH.SymanSyntax:
Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
